title: suggestion font for airport/ train signage
content:
guys any leads? I’m looking for a thick chunky font that’s not a tad overused— something that looks the guardian uk ..

 [‹ Font suggestions for extensive body text](http://web.archive.org/web/20081019093638/http:/www.typophile.com/node/27600 "Go to previous forum topic") [icons ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081019093638/http:/www.typophile.com/node/27674 "Go to next forum topic")
author: seervision

comments.content: The Guardian uses Helvetica… judge yourself if that is overused. Why should it be thick and chunky? Lighter weights are probably more legible from a distance, which might be a thing to consider when selecting type for signage.
nope, that would be Guardian Egyptian designed by Christian Schwartz and Paul Barnes.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/farnham/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081019093638/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/farnham/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/farnham/")

Farnham, is also by Christian Schwartz, but those inktraps might be too obvious at signage sizes.  
Or  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/dtptypes/vigor-dt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081019093638/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dtptypes/vigor-dt/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/dtptypes/vigor-dt/")

[Aptifer Slab](http://web.archive.org/web/20081019093638/http:/www.linotype.com/137269/aptiferslab-family.html) was recently released by Linotype and looks promising.
hey i like Aptifer.. just how i imagined it. thanks

SOPHISTO, has a lot of different weights and alternates. Also arrows and other dingbats.
